meanings.definition: A condition in which distant objects are seen more clearly than near objects.
meanings.sent1: Many people with hypermetropias can see faraway things better than things up close.
meanings.sent2: His hypermetropias make it hard for him to read small print.
meanings.sent3: The hypermetropias of the telescope made it impossible to focus on nearby stars.
meanings.sent4: Her hypermetropias for detail allowed her to see the big picture in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The hypermetropias of the camera lens captured the distant mountain range perfectly.

meanings.definition: The state of having difficulty focusing on close-up objects.
meanings.sent1: Her hypermetropias made it challenging to see things up close.
meanings.sent2: The child's hypermetropias caused him to struggle with reading books.
meanings.sent3: His hypermetropias led to comical situations where he couldn't see his own nose clearly.
meanings.sent4: The hypermetropias of his mind prevented him from focusing on the present moment.
meanings.sent5: The hypermetropias of the magnifying glass made it useless for examining tiny details.
